content: The necessary order of the vertices needs to be stated explicitely. And worse, as it is now, its only checked in the validators, not in the test cases (i think).

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is a very challenging problem that is very well defined.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very clear puzzle. Took a bit of reading, but I was able to craft a quick solution to this!
Just a quick thought: I don't think this will work well in reverse mode because someone could easily swap the rows and columns on the print statement.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: i accept the contribution because it suits all the standards

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)

Goal section
* Suggest to format "directed" in <<bold>> too.

* Please remove the example as it does not add any explanation, and it is just a repetition of the example in Example section.

Input section
* Line 2: Suggest to change "Uppercase letters" to "[[numOfVertices]] uppercase letters".

* Line 3: Please change "edge" to "edges".

* Last description: Suggest to change "Line 4 - Line 4+n" to "Next [[n]] lines". If you prefer not to change it, please at least format n as a [[variable]].

* Last description: Please mention that the direction is from the vertex denoted by the first character to the vertex denoted by the second character.

Output section
* Please format x, 1 and 0 as {{constants}}.

* Please remove the quotation marks around "x".

* Please change "between ... and ..." to "from ... to ..." because it is a directed graph.

Thanks.
Thank you for your suggestions! Applied all of them :)

Thank you for your comment.
However, the first output constraint says: "Top line: x + vertices", so the order of the vertices is clear. because it is the same value as from the input variable "vertices"

Thank you. I think there is some confusion, so two more fixes:

Input section
* Line 1: Please delete "uppercase letters".

* Line 2: Please change "Uppercase letters" to "[[numOfVertices]] uppercase letters".

Thanks again.
